column4: Sorry, I was disconnected for the last 3 minutes: What does it wait for since the last initrd update that came from edgy-security?
sorry i didn't understand that question
it is always the number of ticks on the CPU's timestamp counter (or some multiple of it if not the exact counter).  it's an absolute value.  since the CPU started
since the last reboot, rather i believe
you have libdvdcss?
Yes.
it looks like a region problem, maybe
(you know how DVDs have different regions)  that could be one reasons
but it's probably a libdvdcss problem and i dont know how to fix that
hmmm ... I can watch the menu and some not encrypted trailers. So I think it's no region problem. Is there a newer version of libdvdcss2 than I used?
no idea.  which one did you use..?
So, do you have any other solution than moving that partition to lower sectors?
sorry i am not sure, but i did not se your error before.  now that i do see it, the bios may matter
hmmm, ok.
can you give me any more detalis on the circumstances and what may have caused the error?

I created a new partition /dev/sda7. When I run `grub` from the cmd line, its tab completion shows me that new partition as (hd0,6). But when I reboot (hd0,6) can't be found. In edit mode the last available partition is (hd0,5). Any idea how to make grub re-read the partitions?
odd.  you seem to be losing a partition, then?
Yes, but I can access it w/o problems from runnning Ubuntu ...
ya. grub might use bios to enumerate, and ubuntu may use the controller directly.  but that's a guess
i'm not sure there's a more reliable way, but you could concoct some dd(disk druid) command to do it, maybe
No, the smaller target will be a problem there. I'd have to shrink the fs first.
I was rather looing for tool that could do all that in one go.
i don't believe there is any filesystem-independent tool that would do that, but the ext3 or xfs or whichever FS you use may have a tool to migrate a filesystem
if archiving the whole thing up ("imaging") it is easier you could do that like soundray suggested
